intro: Andira retusa var. paraguariensis, commonly known as the Paraguayan beautyberry, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Paraguay and Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant flowers that transition into bright purple berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. The berries are not only ornamental but also have traditional uses in local medicine.
